Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dave F
Reviews.Content: I was a little wary of this hotel when I saw it didnt have interior hallways, but I figured it was only for one night. I wish I had stayed there the whole week. Very nice hotel whose rooms were extremely clean and in good repair. The entire staff was very friendly and responsive to all I asked about. They even had a nice breakfast served in a small breakfast area. Rooms had a small kitchenette. It was easy to walk to the strip, but they do offer a shuttle to and from select stops. I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very neat pool!”
Reviews.Author: UncleCharlie
Reviews.Content: Nice room, included a full kitchenette. Very accommodating; one son arrived a few hours ahead of the rest of us, and they let him into one of our rooms. The little pool was spectacular - a miniature version of something you would find at a swanky resort!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: travelkitty50
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was off the strip and didn't have a noisy casino to traverse to get from A to B. The staff was welcoming and accommodating to my every request, even asking us our room and bed preference. There is a computer in the lobby which is open 24/7, and a good breakfast offered each morning. The shuttle driver, Jose, was wonderful to us and helped us a lot with directions. The Terrible's restaurant was within two blocks of the room and I had one of the best prime rib dinners ever there for $10. The Hard Rock was also within walking distance, as well as a 24 hour CVS and several other restaurants. This location is a 5 minute drive from the airport, but is relatively quiet at night. It is all non smoking rooms, and rooms have kitchenettes. My shower was good and hot, the towels were fluffy, and the bed was firm. What else could one want?

Reviews.Title: “better than average”
Reviews.Author: capthowe
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful and friendly. Great location, great price, great shuttle service to and from airport and to downtown. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not satisfied with anything in hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveling f
Reviews.Content: We had been las vegas for new year's eve 2012 and unfortunately I booked this hotel thinking that their standards are better than others. I have got this hotel for 240$/night but I should say it's not worth it!! I still regret why did I book this hotel.. service was poor and no elevators to this hotel. Staff were not polite and kinda ready to argue for every silly thing. Not sure how they planning this hotel, but I got say that's really frustrating when you have lot of luggage. They keep charging your credit card for some reason and I had to call them for every charge. Those charges were not in terms and conditions anywhere and they didn't mention about any additional charges. This is one ugly hotel in beautiful Las Vegas city!! I absolutely would not recommend this hotel to families or couples.

Reviews.Title: “FALSE ADVERTISING AND APATHETIC”
Reviews.Author: AirPirate
Reviews.Content: Website says airport shuttle runs 5am-1am, but in reality it run 6am-10pm. That's a real problem if you plan your flight around this lie. When we called to find out where the shuttle was, the employee who answered (Abil) was VERY apathetic, hung up on me, and it wasn't until I called back and got someone else did they reluctantly agree to compensate a cab fair. I'll sleep in the airport before I stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “A good deal for the location”
Reviews.Author: kensmiles
Reviews.Content: For those familiar with Comfort Inn, there will be no surprises here. A plain, fairly small but clean room with a kitchenette. (No utensils) Walk to the Hard Rock and a few food choices in a little strip mall (with a CVS) down the block. There was airplane noise but the property's name should alert you to that. I passed on the breakfast because the choices were loaded with carbs. Coffee was good though. My only complaint is that there was no Wifi reception in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: gertrude22
Reviews.Content: Great location! Could walk to several restaurants. The room was great although smaller than some but with a kitchenette. Best room for the price that we have had in a long time. It was clean. Breakfast was good. The only negative is that we weren't told about a free shuttle to the strip. Otherwise we can heartily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Our 5 Day Stay”
Reviews.Author: momlady
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right across the street from the Hard Rock Casino. There is construction at night from 10pm-4pm, but we never heard anything from that while asleep. Yes you do have planes flying over head but not constant. You are at the airport location of Comfort Inn, so you should expect some plane noise. I have issues with my back and the Bed was ok not luxury but at least I didn't wake up hurting as I usually do. They do have a small kitchen with a 2 burner electric stove, with a microwave and fridge, but no pots n pans,dishes or silverware but I can understand why, nothing would stay it would get appropriated. We were in room 401 which was a lower unit and did not have any issues with noise. Did not use the pool did drive by it and it is small. The room was quite warm and had to use the AC quite a bit to keep the room comfortable. Very clean rooms, we did not see any unexpected critters. Continental Breakfast was good, only issue I had was the fact they did not have any sugar free items for people with diabetes. Did have some issues with the internet and our cell phones would not work in the room we had to go outside and down the road a bit, not sure why as I was connected to their Wi Fi connection.

Reviews.Title: “Okay in a Pinch”
Reviews.Author: glad25
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for two nights, October 28/29, as my husband did not want to stay on the strip, and the hotels on the strip were over-priced that weekend. Upon check-in I was informed by Todd that we only had the room for one night, and that I would have to phone TripRes to sort it out. The lady at TripRes said that I did have it booked for two nights. Todd did not get back to me, so I checked back later, and was informed by another clerk that the room always was booked for two nights. Todd did not inform me about the shuttle to the strip or give me the passwords to connect to the internet. I walked the one mile to the strip and back again, only to find out later that I could have taken the shuttle. Todd lacked some customer service skills to say the least. The hotel was very clean and adequate,and it is always nice to have a fridge and a coffee maker. However, the hotel was very noisy at night and in the early morning. Also, there is lots of noise from the planes flying overhead. To sum it up, I would probably only stay here again in a pinch.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: retiredtraveler142
Reviews.Content: An overnight prior to a morning flight out prompted our stay and the motel delivered everything promised. Check-in was quick and efficient, as was check out. The room was clean, comfortable and above average size, with an extra sink as well as a two burner electric stove top, in addition to the microwave and small refrigerator, allowing a longer stay. The bed was of moderate firmness. The shuttle to the airport runs from 6 AM and takes less than ten minutes; it can also take you to nearby casinos, etc. You are within one block walking distance of perhaps eight to ten nice restaurants. Even though proximity to the airport causes very loud jet noise outside, there was no such problem in the room itself. Breakfast was complimentary and typical of Comfort Inns, with do-it-yourself waffles in addition to the normal cereal, juices, small pastries and hardboiled eggs. We plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: GwynB_11
Reviews.Content: I called the hotel from the airport. Waited 45 minutes for a pick up. Then had to sit and wait for another almost 20 minutes for someone else to come out. Then I get to the hotel and I told the front desk person I needed to be to the airport at 4:15 in the morning. SHuttle doesn't start running again until 6 AM. Doesn't say on their website what times of day it runs. I finally get settled in. And I constantly hear things. The air conditioner never got my room cold. And when I woke up at 3:15 in the morning to shower the water got cold on me. Never ever will i ever recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: woodsdweller
Reviews.Content: We flew into Las Vegas spening the night here before heading off to Yosemite and Death Valley. Good accomodations with a continental breakfast that included waffles. The room had a little kitchenette with fridge and microwave. We noted they have airport shuttle and shuttle to the strip, so it would work well for staying in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Smokey & Old”
Reviews.Author: casper684
Reviews.Content: Wanted to be away from casinos so stayed here. Lobby area smelled like smoke but we had requested a "non" smoking room (HA in Las Vegas hard to come by). Room was in the non smoking section and still smelled like smoke. Place looks nice but beds are old and squeaky and not all that comfortable. Arrived late so just spent the one night and then checked out and moved to the Rio. Room had a fridge, stove and microwave but NOTHING to cook with or kitchen supplies. Be advised that one section has smoking rooms on one level and "non" smoking above or below that! Definately would NOT stay here again. We're used to Comfort Suite in Castro Valley, California. A FABULOUS place to stay that is COMPLETELY "non smoking"!

Reviews.Title: “Average place”
Reviews.Author: Imzpickle
Reviews.Content: Pros...free shuttle to airport, decent room w/ small kitchenette if needed, AC worked well, close to food and strip. Cons...staff not friendly when we checked in or out the next morning. Different staff, same indifferent attitude, website says shuttle starts running 5am and it doesn't until 6am, so double-check shuttle time if you need it for early morning flight.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay; got our money's worth!”
Reviews.Author: ladyfern31
Reviews.Content: After a week of being nickle and dimed at the Paris Las Vegas during a convention, it was a huge relief to have this room on our last night in Las Vegas. We decided to move out of the Paris for our last night and try to save some money, before catching our early morning flight. We booked online. We arrived earlier than check-in, and due to a full night, our room was not ready. The staff was extremely helpful (Michael was very pleasant), and held our bags so that we could get lunch. The hotel is located across the street from the Hard Rock Cafe, and a block from the Hofbrauhaus. There was a CVS Pharmacy on the corner (which was doing booming business in the beer and soda trade due to Las Vegas prices). We returned at 3 pm and our room was ready. The room was a very clean King that offered a little kitchenette with stove top, microwave, refrigerator and coffee maker. It had a small bathroom with sink located outside. The air conditioning was perfect for our 110 degree day. Also, our room was right next to the street, and we heard no street noise at all. There was free cable TV with too many channels to name, free wi-fi, access to in-room dining service and a pool. The hotel offered a complimentary breakfast in the morning, and free airport shuttle. There was a computer with printer for use in the lobby, and coffee in the lobby 24-hours, and snack vending machines. I still can't figure out why smaller hotels like this can offer all of these free services for half the price of the larger hotels, and why the larger hotels that charge twice as much or more nickle and dime for these comforts (if you can even get them). For a middle-class, working couple on a moderate income, our stay at the Comfort Inn Airport made up for a miserable week at the Paris Las Vegas. I whole-heartedly encourage a stay at this establishment on your next visit to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Great value just off strip”
Reviews.Author: EricHabsman
Reviews.Content: Great value for price, with clean rooms, free breakfast/parking/wifi. We stayed one night as an add on to our stay on the strip (due to budget considerations), and this hotel served its purpose as a good value, basic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Serviceable for the price”
Reviews.Author: mobar024
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Inn Airport is worked very well for sleep, without the frills of the neighboring Casino Hotels. The staff were very accommodating, and the shuttle worked well for travel to the airport during regular business hours. I'd recommend this motel to those seeking a cheap place to stay while attending concerts at the Hard Rock casino.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: family778811
Reviews.Content: arrived in las vegas a day early and our hotel for the next night was booked. found this one late and not even sure where it was when we called the 800#, drove to it before booking. just around the corner from the strip. nice staff, good breakfast and the lady in the breakfast room was friendly and restocking the food, wiping up spills very helpful. room very general hotel room, but clean and did have a small kitchenette. would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed opinion”
Reviews.Author: heund
Reviews.Content: We chose this Comfort inn based on nearness to airport as well as strip - however, it is still a mile or so to walk to strip (esp in hot weather), so the free shuttle is very helpful. On other hand, nearness to airport a problem with airplane noise, as one of runways puts planes right over this motel. breakfast small but adequate; small pool but no hot tub. Staff friendly. Price great, so good value - though must consider noise a major disadvantage.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for short stay”
Reviews.Author: maltbyminers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good and easy location to find, within a short distance to the Strip. We travelled with in a family of four, with two boys aged 14 and 11 and stayed for one night. The room was adequate in size and the beds were also large enough, comfortable and had no evidence of bed-bugs. We were able to park very close to our room, which was on the ground floor, facing away from the main road. As such, we did not hear any noise from the surrounding roads or adjacent rooms , however as noted in other reviews, the hotel is within the flightpath of the airport and overhead planes do make a noise. The planes stopped landing between the approximate hours of 11pm til 6am so we did enjoy a good nights sleep. We felt safe although the hotel is located next to a strip club. The breakfast is self serve and had a good variety even for our children, including cereals and a waffle maker. The staff were friendly and efficient. Overall, the hotel is a good choice for those on a limited budget on a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Better places for same price”
Reviews.Author: MEDENS
Reviews.Content: Husband had an unexpected stay for the night in Vegas on a VERY busy weekend of the year - St. Patty's and NCAA Bball games. I met him for the night only bc it was a free trip and weekend night. The hotel was nice to have a shuttle to the Strip, which we took advantage of the day of arrival. The next day it was too long of a wait to get the shuttle since we were pressed for time. The trip was spent mostly at strip, of course a good time no matter what. We arrived back via cab around 3 a.m. and thought we'd get enough sleep - WRONG ! Lots of activity outide the door - as it's a motel/ and the plane path to landing at LAS. Basically, if I were planning a trip to Vegas, this is not a place I would stay. My parents managed to get a room the same night we were in town for very cheap on the strip at TI for only $100. We visited them and they were staying at a 5STAR compared to where we were. Just take everything into consideration before booking. It's not on the strip, and sometimes better deals can be found. Had we had a choice in the matter, we would NOT have stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value and Great Amenities!”
Reviews.Author: sneezylisa
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from April 9-15 with three of my colleagues for the NAB 2011 conference. I had originally booked another hotel but upon reading the reviews of that hotel, I decided to switch. Comfort Inn Airport had a good rate and had lots of valuable amenities so I switched our booking. We had shipped two packages, one large hockey bag and one heavy metal crate down to the Comfort Inn that arrived prior to our arrival. They kept them housed for us for a few days, which was very nice, and they had them ready for us when we requested them. l also called ahead twice to make sure that it would be okay to ship directly to them and that they would have adequate storage space as the hockey bag was quite large. Both of my telephone conversations were nice and the employees on the other end were very helpful and pleasant (this has not been my experience with other hotels in general and I was very happy! gave me hope that this hotel/staff would be great). When arriving, we made the mistake of going directly out to the shuttle area near the baggage claim and were told that there was no shuttle for the Comfort Inn (which is not true at all! we were just in the wrong place) and the shuttle we had to take cost us $7 each one way. We were able to check in before 3PM (I think we arrived around noon actually, so well in advance and no additional fee either!!) and had two rooms in building 5, both on the lower level. I believe there are 9 buildings both two levels with a pool in the middle. Our room had 2 double beds with plenty of pillows, a tv, desk, small fridge, extra sink and tap, microwave and good storage for food or dishes (should you have any). The toilet and shower were separated by a door from the vanity area where we had good room to keep two suitcases open (and this was nice as I was rooming with a colleague - I was able to do my makeup and hair while he was contained in the room with the shower) Onto the amenities! Complementary Shuttle: Of all the amenities the hotel offered, this was by far the most valuable for us as we were traveling to the Las Vegas Convention Centre every day and went to the strip a few nights as well. The shuttle was normally waiting at the lobby area and if not, it was always back within 10-15 minutes of us arriving at the lobby to catch it. All of the drivers were very nice and friendly and a few gave us some good recommendations for where to eat, find things and generally were talkative and personable. Complementary Breakfast: I saw a few complaints about the breakfast but for free, there's nothing to complain about!! They offered danishes, english muffins, bagels, muffins, juice, coffee, tea, hard boiled eggs, make-your-own-fresh waffles and some fruit. Being in Las Vegas on business, we never had enough time to go out and find breakfast at another venue so this was perfect for us! I saw a bunch of complaints about the eggs being 'de shelled' but really, I could care less. The shell is the most annoying part of the egg and someone else took care of it for me. That, and they were a very popular breakfast item - most guests we saw in the adjoining breakfast seating area were eating the eggs every day. Most days we were up for breakfast around 7:30 but on our last day we made it there at 9 and the supplies were running low (breakfast ends at 10), which is to be expected, but it wasn't like they were out of food, we were able to have our choice of all the items offered. Complementary Internet: most hotels in Las Vegas charge at least $15 (some per day and some per stay) for internet, wireless and wired internet is free, which was a big must have for us tech people on business. Very nice to have this and it be fast. I had to download content at the last minute before leaving for the tradeshow and was able to do so within about 8 minutes (BIG file too) on the wired internet. We had a few nights where there was some noise outside our room but it was mostly other guests heading to their rooms after partying and the only reason I heard that was because I'm an incredibly light sleeper. The proximity to the airport wasn't really a big deal either as the last plane takes off around 1130, latest. There are lots of things to do in the area around this Comfort Inn, including being across from the Hard Rock, and a 5-minute walk from a CVS, pizza place (pretty good btw), an italian sit down restaurant, a sub/sandwich place, a Subway and more. I doubt that you could ask for anything more from a hotel at this price point!! Don't let some of the mixed reviews of this hotel sway you - our experience was great and it exceeded all of my expectations! Big thanks to all of the staff that we encountered on our visit - we will be back for NAB 2012 next year and will definitely book at the Comfort Inn Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Older property but very well maintained. Kitchenettes standard in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: SurfingTheWedge
Reviews.Content: Located on Paradise Road across from the Hard Rock makes this a prime location from which to strike out on the town. Decent room size and comfortable. Good towels, good bed, and great rates. Additionally the front desk staff is awesome. Very professional and willing to handle guest's needs 24/7. That about says it all.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, despite being so close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Tripsterchick
Reviews.Content: Very convenient if you’re heading to McCarran Airport and extremely quiet considering the hotel is on the flight path of inbound planes (it’s astonishing how low they fly overhead). Expect to hear some air traffic during daylight hours, but by nightfall there don’t seem to be many flights. There’s a pretty constant flow of vehicles on Paradise Road, but again, we were not disturbed. (We had asked for a quiet room and were given one at the back of the hotel.) The room was clean, comfortable and well equipped; as well as the standard fridge, microwave and coffee maker, it had a two-burner stove, kitchen sink and lots of cupboard space. Pots, pans, dishes, etc. are not placed in the room, but they’re supplied if you ask for them at the front desk. We were only overnighting so had no need for these items, but they could be handy if you were staying longer. A continental breakfast including cereal, boiled eggs, cream cheese, muffins, bagels, oranges and apples is provided, and the hotel offers a free airport shuttle from 8 a.m. to 11 p.m. If you’re returning a rental car to the airport, you’ll find a gas station three blocks from the hotel, en route to McCarran. The drive to the car return location on Gilespie Road takes about ten minutes. There are quite a few dining options just steps from the hotel. The Hard Rock Café is across the street, the Hofbrauhaus is on the next corner, and there are various small restaurants and a liquor store in the adjacent strip mall. If you prefer the Strip, the hotel offers free shuttle service there and back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and save money in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: traveldoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night to escape the "weekend rates" of the strip hotels. LIKED: 1) Location - close to Strip but quieter. 2) Cost - very reasonable. 3) Included breakfast - besides saving money - the time savings is awesome. And most of the Strip hotels do not have coffee makers. 4) Stove and fridge. 5) Parking right next to your room - on the Strip - even when you get a "good" parking spot, you are at least a half mile from your room. DIDN'T LIKE: The breakfast room was "tight" and felt crowded. This made getting food and drinks awkward, and the room where you eat - you felt like you were sitting on top of other people. This is a small complaint and I appreciated the free breakfast - but this would be a powerful improvement to an already good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast disappointment”
Reviews.Author: MatriarchInTraining
Reviews.Content: If you want a hot breakfast included with your room, you might want to stay elsewhere. This property has converted one of the guest rooms to the breakfast area. It is very small and crowded, and there is nowhere to eat. You have to take your food back to your room. So if you make a waffle, toast, etc., it is cold by the time you get back to your room

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag but mostly good”
Reviews.Author: jammex88
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, budget motel good value, free WIFI (very fast) no big surprises, you get what you pay for. Problems: It is a bit noisy because it is in the flight path of the airport so every couple minutes you hear planes going overhead. Overnight though this was not a problem. Also, being a budget motel, you do hear people above you, walking past outside, etc. Again, not a big problem. Do not expect much from the free breakfast buffet...especially if you are interested in eating healthy..it is mostly waffles, pre-packaged pastry, sugary cereals, very little fruit, no yogurt. There were some hard boiled eggs, but curiously they were already peeled...I don't know who peeled them (or why?) but it looked unappetizing and unsanitary. Free shuttle to the Airport. Free parking. Lots of restaurants nearby..go north half a block to Flamingo and there are lots of options, including a Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Two Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: fitR99
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because I couldn't seem to get a good price on the strip and my expectations were exceeded. From the time their Complimentary Airport Shuttle driver picked me up I felt at peace. Upon arrival Tiffany made my check in process a real breeze which I really appreciated after 5 hours of flying...Thanks Tiffany. But everyone was great. Great Staff. And even the complimentary breakfast was good. Will is one of the other shuttle driver I met... really cool characeter. I will definitely return to the comfort Inn..

Reviews.Title: “nice spread and close parking to our rooms”
Reviews.Author: tkasper3
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, nice pool, close to MGM and other locations. We even got a limo from this hotel. It was restful and we felt safe. It was clean and the breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “great value for Las Vegsa”
Reviews.Author: littlerascal88
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not one the strip but there is free shuttle to the strip which is great. We also get free shuttle service from the airport. our room was clean with mini kitchen. Breakfast was basic but enough varieties. there is also free wi-fi which a plus for us. For $70 a night on the weekend is a bargain compare to the mega hotel. Check in an out was fast and the workers were very friendly. We definitely will return to this hotel the next time we go there.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, big and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Carasson
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in May 2010. We really like the fact that it was 5 min by car from the strip, it was very calm and quiet so no problem to sleep. Rooms were large and comfortable. The pool area is also nice. Free parking and good breakfast. We could come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: patraveler101
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at a Comfort Inn in Vegas instead of at one of the casino hotels. It was one of the best choices we made. They had in-room refridges, extra shampoo, continental breakfast, shuttle to and from the airport, plus to the casino's downtown. Rooms were very clean and sunny, (no pun intended). This hotel was so much better then the Borgata in Atlanic City N.J. AND they offered free in-room internet!!! Borgata you had to pay for that too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, if it's what you're looking for.”
Reviews.Author: Wayside55
Reviews.Content: Admittedly, many casino hotels offer better rooms for less money. You also have to park far from your room, pay for internet and other services, wait on line for check-in, and be tempted by the casino at every moment. I come to Vegas often, and I've stayed in this hotel several times. It is clean, affordable, offers fast, free internet, and every room has it's own kitchenette. Plus, you can park right outside your room. It is across the street from the Hard Rock hotel, and provides easy access to the strip. If you don't have a car, do not stay here. But if you have a car and are looking for this type of place, you'll be very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: jrmigs
Reviews.Content: Was out for a conference and the host hotel was full. Comfort was about a half block away. We enjoyed being next door to the Hard Rock Cafe and Casino. We ate at each - good prices great food. The hotel is very well kept - very clean. The breakfast included waffles, fruit, cereals, lots of bakery, hard boiled eggs. Generous enough to keep you going most of the day. What a deal. Best part was our airport shuttle driver - Peter - who gave us some great tips - took us to and from the Strip. A great personality! The girls at the front desk were very nice and helpful too! This isn't a resort - the pool is small and like everything, its right under the airport path - but it is a great value and if you stay here, you can still go down to the strip and blow even more money. --

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: mary42California
Reviews.Content: i came to las vegas for my son winter vac. and every hotel was booked , or the prices were to high , i was driving by and i saw comfort inn on paradise rd, it was a great location near UNLV, Hard Rock hotel , about one 1 mile from the Las Vegas strip. resturants near by with in walkiing distance, shuttle service was great, Front desk was amazing , rooms were very nice, and quiet,.. my trip was great and i will be returning to this hotel agian .

Reviews.Title: “You can do a lot better!!”
Reviews.Author: jessotr
Reviews.Content: I've got to knock this place down several notches. First, the front desk guys were rude and seemed to just wish we would go away upon checking in. Not just passively rude, extrovertedly rude and unprofessional (even by Comfort Inn standards, yes). The hotel is in a noisy, crummy spot. I could hear tons of loud cars and shouting from my first floor (outside corridor) room near Paradise Rd. I know it's Vegas, but the door to my room was very thin. As a solo girl traveler, I didn't feel that safe there. Room cleanliness was not great. They only had wired internet. Breakfast is bare bones and packed with people. I was really disappointed with this place since the other reviews on here made it sound fine. Right when you walk into the horribly outdated lobby, you'll know...if you make the mistake of thinking you can't afford anything else in Vegas. On the contrary, I later used Priceline.com (easy to use) to get a much much nicer room on the strip for less money than I paid to stay at the Comfort Inn. For even $80 you should be able to get a good room on the strip, if that's what you're looking for. You will probably enjoy that much, much more than this crummy Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Anijo
Reviews.Content: After getting very bad directions I was finally able to find the hotel. I was surprised by the location. Very conveniently located across from UNLV and the Hard Rock Cafe. The pictures make it look really nice, but the rooms were a bit run down. They could use some updating. The beds could have been more comfortable. Very used rooms. They seemed to be pretty clean though. Very quiet. Stayed 1 night and that was enough. The breakfast was basic but enough was available. The room was small, so it got a bit over crowded and people were tripping on each other to get at the food. My son left his short and shirt. We called after leaving and had the hold it at the desk. We picked them up on our return, which surprise me that they actually found them! That was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for location and cost”
Reviews.Author: foxxybrown
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August 2007 and was very surprised because normally, I would stay in at least a 4 star hotel. Honestly when looking at this hotel online is not very appealing, however, when you actually see it in person, it really is not that bad. Granted it is not a new hotel by any means, but it is reasonable for what you pay per night. Breakfast here was served daily for free and was really good. The only thing that I did not care for was that the carpet in our room was really dirty, but again, we did not even notice this until our last day there. If you are looking for luxury of any type, this is not the hotel for you, however, if you want to go to Vegas and have more money in your pockets to gamble, have fun, see a couple of shows and do some shopping, this hotel will allow you to do all that. As for bugs and all that other negative stuff that people are saying, I did not experience any of that. As for the staff, everyone that was there for the week that we stayed there were professional, friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “aircraft spotter delight”
Reviews.Author: ashcan
Reviews.Content: Booked in for 3 nights last week at a very good rate and was happy with its location off the strip but close to the main casinos. The room was fine with 2 queen beds, fridge, TV and micro. We found a few things missing such as the coffee pot + batteries in TV remote and although it was 2200 the reception staff had replacements from another room within minutes. The drawback was being situated under the flightpath as from 0530 to 2300 there were aircraft every few minutes, which woke me up although handy on the last day as we had an early start! The pool was fine, for brits , the water was quite warm and clean, with many people congregating around it with beers each afternoon, but the kids and I enjoyed it. Comments about the lapdancing place next door seem way over the top, no noise or fuss from it. Breakfast was adequate, but only having one toaster in the kitchen for numerous guests was quite poor given the numbers staying at the hotel. Also it closed early for breakfast 0600-0900. Didn't use the shuttle to the strip, happy with self parking and a bit of a walk. Overall good for the price, but the early / late flights disturbs your sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget accomodation”
Reviews.Author: briandamaged
Reviews.Content: Great accomodation for the traveller on a budget. Room was clean, comfortable and fairly quiet (as someone's already said, the air conditioner drowned out any plane noise). Staff were helpful, friendly and efficient, courtesy bus was an absolute godsend, Paul the driver is a lovely guy full of help and advice for first-time visitors. Wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Comfort Inn to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: rcvan1981
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is not too far from the strip (Las Vegas Boulevard) and McCarren Airport, you can generally get a comparable or better room on the strip for the same money. The room was a little outdated and worn. The staff was not bad, but could have been a little friendlier. We did not feel completely safe in the parking lot, either, as the area is somewhat seedy (there is a low-rent strip club next door). We were just looking for something close to the airport for one night, after traveling elsewhere, but I probably would not stay here again unless I got a good bargain. There are a couple of nice things, though, like the Hard Rock Casino being just across the street and the free shuttle service to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “What a let down”
Reviews.Author: Discussed
Reviews.Content: We went back to the Comfort Inn having stayed last year. This year we were very very disapointed. We stayed for 16 days - never again. The Room carpets were filthy our feet were black after walking on them with no shoes. The pool was a aboslute disgrace, I complained to the manager and shamed him into inspecting the pool with me, this was a waste of time as nothing was done, they advertised a heated pool and it was absolutley freezing, the staff argued with me telling me it was not cold - I was the fool in the water. I would advise any one thinking of staying longer than a few days to look else where. I complained to the head office who replied to me basicley telling me tough its a franchise and there was not much they could do. Well I know what I can do - not go there ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it”
Reviews.Author: RonLancaster
Reviews.Content: Liked it Neat and clean with a courteous but efficient staff that had me checked into the hotel in two minutes, I was attending a show at the Thomas & Mack Center, to which I could walk to, and miss all the traffic. Close to everything, however maybe to close to the airport, but so is many other downtown hotels at three times the price. Enjoyed my stay, and liked the refrigerator and microwave in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay @ the Comfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: MarioTheGreat
Reviews.Content: I'm almost packed and ready to leave. This is my 5th trip here and 1st time in the Comfort Inn. When I arrived in town and drove by, I laughed and just shook my head. I was laughing at how cheap the company I work for was. It's a motel type setting with the doors on the outside. So, I checked in, got my key, went to my room and was surprised. Sure, it's a small room, but it has 2 beds, a mini coil burner range, a mini fridge, a huge selection of cable channels, free dsl (bring your own cable OR borrow on of theirs!), a place to hang your clothes and a decent shower. Other than a minor problem with my key, this stay has been great. I'm not here to stay in a hotel room all day so I wouldn't notice anything other than the obvious. There are planes flying overhead every 7 minutes when the planes are routed on a certain runway. Wow, other than that, everything was great. Can't say enough about it. If you look at other reviews (complaints), there are NO ants, I'm not wearing socks, the staff was above average and well, that's it. Next time I'm in town, I'm going to ask to stay here. Look, I've been in $165 night rooms here in Vegas and I'm happier here. If you PLAN on coming to Vegas and STAYING in your room, maybe this place isn't for you. But for BUSINESS travelers who aren't in their room, this place rocks! Free DSL that's running at 1.5+!!! For me, this location is great. I can get to everywhere I need to be within 30 minutes!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad..”
Reviews.Author: palacegirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn during our stay at Vegas. It wasn't as bad as I expected. It is off strip, so we had to rely on the shuttle to take us to the strip, or take a cab. The hotel itself was clean and pretty well-maintained. It is next to a strip club, but it wasn't that bad. My only complaint was the shuttle service. It took forever and the door on the van was broke. Hopefully they have it fixed by now.

Reviews.Title: “good wake up call”
Reviews.Author: nestofvipers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Comfort Inn in November for 4 nights. The bed was so large I wasn't sure if my husband was there half the time, and being Vegas maybe he wasn't. The rooms were comfortable with a little kitchenette and coffee maker. Good wake up call, planes landing from about 6 am,flying directly overhead. After a few days though we really didn't notice them. There was a shuttle to and from take you to the strip all day. This was needed as it was along walk to the strip and there is a lot of building work going on so pavements uneven.The drivers were great. If you need to get to the strip quicker, walk ove rto the Hard Rock hotel and get a taxi. Breakfast was a bit of a scramble for the one toaster, so lot of queueing and it was basic. I read somone else's review that there were perverts and drunks about, they must have been unlucky. It was very quiet, security guards on patrol at night. There was no noise or problem with the 'stripclub' next door. Actually I never saw anyone going in even! If you like shopping there is a nice shopping mall about 20/30 mins walk on maryland parkway. It is lovely and quiet there, with Macys, JCPenny and Sears plus little shops. Not a bad place to stay on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, No Problems Here”
Reviews.Author: Tucsontourist
Reviews.Content: I am a Choice Hotel member and decided randomly to vacation in Las Vegas for a week. I looked for a hotel that was centrally located to the show (Phantom of the Opera) that I wanted to see, and was close to the airport and the strip, which I had never been to. There were no major problems, other than the wake up call not coming in one day, but after we mentioned it to the front desk staff, they were very good after that. It is unfortunate that the shuttle to the airport and the strip only runs until 10:30 p.m., since Vegas is open all night, and we got in to the airport after 10:30 p.m., but the taxi was reasonable, even if the exit from the airport was confusing. MGM is the only drop-off on the strip, but we used the monorail and got very used to coming and going on our own. We were across the street from the Hard Rock Casino and Motel, so we tried to end up there every night and walked across the street to our hotel at the end of the evening (morning). It did seem a bit strange that our hotel was next to an adult club, but we have a great room and a great stay, and couldn't have asked for much more, considering the very reasonable rate we paid and the fact that we were there for 8 days. We became very familiar with the shuttle drivers, who were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Worst place on our vacation”
Reviews.Author: dlh6471
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned to Ohio after a three-week tour of the southwest. Of all the hotels we stayed at, the Las Vegas Comfort Inn at 4350 Paradise Road was the worse one of all. The carpet was so dirty that after walking over it once in bare feet or socks, the bottom your feet were black--literally. After talking a shower, if you stepped on the carpet you tracked black footsteps onto the tile bathroom floor. Finally my husband layed down a path of towels to walk on around the room. There were also stains on the chairs that looked suspiciously like human ejaculation--nasty. If it wasn't for the fact that this was a last minute booking and everything else in town was full--we would have found something else. When checking out, I told the clerk about he horrid conditions and he replied that they ALREADY knew about the problem and that we were not the first to complain--and, they knew some of the rooms should have the carpet cleaned. He seemed very unsympathetic and unconcerned. A very unpleasant end to an otherwise great vacation.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 4350 Paradise Road, Las Vegas, NV 89109
